required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single-step Versus Sequential Media in Preimplantation Embryo Development and Pregnancy Rates
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Single-step (Global) Versus Sequential Media (Origio) in Preimplantation Embryo Development and Pregnancy Rates

brief_summary.textblock: Sequential culture media were introduced in order to meet the changing requirements of the developing embryo in vitro. However, there has been renewed interest in the use of single-step media, which allow the embryo itself to choose the necessary nutrients while maintaining a more stable culture environment. Previous studies suggest that sequential media do not appear superior to single-step media.

detailed_description.textblock:
Sequential culture media were introduced in order to meet the changing requirements of the developing embryo in vitro. However, there has been renewed interest in the use of single-step media, which allow the embryo itself to choose the necessary nutrients while maintaining a more stable culture environment. Previous studies suggest that sequential media do not appear superior to single-step media.
The current study will include 2 RCTs:
RCT 1: Random allocation of sibling oocytes to compare embryo development and blastocyst formation rates in the two culture media compared.
RCT2: Random allocation of patients in either Global or Origio media, to evaluate pregnancy rates.

primary_outcome.description: Number of fetal sacs with positive heart beat at 7 weeks of gestation

secondary_outcome.description: Embryos reaching the blastocyst stage on Day 5 post oocyte retrieval
Good quality blastocysts are considered at least full blastocysts (stage 3 and above) with grade A or grade B inner-cell mass and trophectoderm respectively.
Pregnancy test as assessed by detection of hCG using blood test
Miscarriage per positive hCG test up to 12 weeks of gestation

arm_group.description: In vitro embryo culture in single-step medium (Global)
In vitro embryo culture in sequential media (Origio)

intervention.description: Single medium for the culture of embryos from Day1 to Day 5
Sequential media medium for the culture of embryos from Day1 to Day 3 (ISM1) and from Day 3 to Day 5 (BlastAssist)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- <40 years of age
- female infertility patients
- at least 10 retrieved oocytes
Exclusion Criteria:
- 41 years or older
- frozen-thawed oocytes/embryos
- oocyte donation cycles

reference.citation: Sepúlveda S, Garcia J, Arriaga E, Diaz J, Noriega-Portella L, Noriega-Hoces L. In vitro development and pregnancy outcomes for human embryos cultured in either a single medium or in a sequential media system. Fertil Steril. 2009 May;91(5):1765-70. doi: 10.1016/j.fertnstert.2008.02.169. Epub 2008 Apr 25.

Basile N, Morbeck D, García-Velasco J, Bronet F, Meseguer M. Type of culture media does not affect embryo kinetics: a time-lapse analysis of sibling oocytes. Hum Reprod. 2013 Mar;28(3):634-41. doi: 10.1093/humrep/des462. Epub 2013 Jan 12.
